benchmark_details.name: CT-Eval (Chinese Text-to-Table Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: CT-Eval is a Chinese text-to-table dataset designed to benchmark large language models (LLMs) on the task of generating structured tables from unstructured documents, ensuring data diversity and minimizing hallucination issues.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark large language models on Chinese text-to-table tasks and improve their performance.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While human cleaning is applied in validation and test sets, the training set still contains hallucination issues.

data.source: Baidu Baike (a popular Chinese multidisciplinary online encyclopedia)
data.annotation: Human annotation combined with LLM hallucination judging to clean the data.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the number of correct non-header cells in the predicted tables compared to the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision and recall indicate a better ability in extracting and structuring the information.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 serves as a baseline, achieving the best zero-shot performance.
methodology.validation: Traditional metrics evaluation against human judgment and LLM-generated outputs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data from Baidu Baike is authorized for academic usage.
